newsitem.title: FRANCE: France has funds for capital injections - minister.
newsitem.headline: France has funds for capital injections - minister.

text.p: France has sufficient resources for the capital injections needed for some state companies, Finance Minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn told a news conference.
He said that privatisation revenues could be either used to reduce state debt or to refinance state companies that need cash.
"In any case it is a balance sheet operation, it does not enter into the results," he said, indicating the revenues cannot be used to reduce the state's budget deficit.
On Friday, the Socialist-led government said it would continue with the privatisation of insurer GAN, which needs a 20 billion franc capital injection, as well as its CIC banking unit.
